intro: Neomammillaria slevinii, commonly known as the Slevin’s nipple cactus, is a small, slow-growing cactus native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its otherwise muted appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
